The fact that we are expending large sxmx sums of foundation
money places upon us a heavy responsibility. In view of the
new financial policy whereby stations pay for the service, this
responsibility is given added weight. If this spending of
the foundations and the station’s money is to be justified,
it is essential that we make every effort to provide the
maximum of service.
Present Operation
. TAPE SUPPLY- With the aid of the University of Illinois
purchasing division we have temporarily, at least, solved the
problem of a supply of tape. The acquisition of 3,000
reels of tape puts us in a momentarily comfortable position.
2. Piling of master copies. We are accumulating a rather large
supply of tapes in our permanent file of programs. At the moment
we are sending out approximately 20 reels per week. In the course
of a year this means over 1,000 reels of tape go into the files.
This doesn’t contribute much to the solving of the tape
supply situation.
3. Technical quality. As of this moment, we are not capable
of producing tapes of consistently excellent mechanical
quality. Since this is an achievable goal, it seems legitimate
fbr the stations to expect nothing but high quality tapes.
